I ❤ JMW Turner

January 2, 2015

Tweet

In 19th century England, John Mallord William Turner was the bomb.com His work was synonymous with the ideals of a the newly emerging Romantic movement- which idealized beauty, tranquility, nature, and a wistful look to the past - in a nation of people that was otherwise pretty busy doing things like ruthlessly dragging its colonies into the industrial revolution

Turner embodied this zeitgeist (such an apt word to describe England at the time that the romantics literally coined it ) he was a rockstar of sorts. Showing at all the fancy art shows of the time, the famous art critic John Ruskin wrote this /completely normal/ thing about his pal Turner’s art:
